variable.comment: The total distance run so far, in pixels.
variable.name: TotalDistance

variable.comment: Counts up to 'NextBlock', at which point a new block is created.
variable.name: CurrentDistance

variable.comment: How often the scrolling speed increases
variable.name: IntervalSecs

variable.comment: Set to 1 if level completed successfully
variable.name: Success

variable.comment: Increase the platform width to help the children
variable.name: ChildrenHelp

variable.comment: The distance after which to create the next block.
variable.name: NextBlock

sub-events.comment: Wrap the scrolling background infinitely by moving it back after it's scrolled the width of the main image to the left.
Due to the acceleration of the platform movement, I need a trick to make sure the player doesn't get pushed off to the left of the screen.
Let's now increase the scrolling speed
While on floor, hold the "run right" control, so that the character keeps running.
Keep incrementing the current and total distances, and update the points.
On any user input at all, make the character jump (or double jump)

Once CurrentDistance reaches NextBlock, it is time to create a new block. Let's create it with a random width, height and angle, then position it just off the right edge of the screen. Make it move to the left again, then set NextBlock to create another block a random distance after this one.
And now le'ts see if it is time to display any powerup
Destroy blocks that go off the left of the screen so they don't keep taking up memory or CPU.
